message:
Hi Jim, thanks for your comments:

1. The library name is `geodata`, it is on [CRAN](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/geodata/index.html). You should be able to install it with
2. `install.packages("geodata")`.
3. The "mapslib" folder is a working folder on my computer where I stored data to avoid re-downloading files. You probably don't have it, so you can use a custom folder as (some examples):

```r
mydir <- "." # Data downloaded on your working folder, see getwd()
```

Or

```r
# Temporary folder
mydir <- tempdir() 

```

Hope this helps.
message_html:
Hi Jim, thanks for your comments:

  1. The library name is geodata, it is on CRAN. You should be able to install it with
    install.packages("geodata").

  2. The “mapslib” folder is a working folder on my computer where I stored data to avoid re-downloading files. You probably don’t have it, so you can use a custom folder as (some examples):

mydir <- "." # Data downloaded on your working folder, see getwd()

Or

# Temporary folder
mydir <- tempdir()

Hope this helps.
